intro: Maytenus deflexa, commonly known as the flexible mayten, is a woody shrub or small tree native to South America. It belongs to the family Celastraceae and is characterized by its twisted, often contorted branches. The plant has small, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. Its flowers are unisexual, with male and female flowers occurring on separate plants. Maytenus deflexa is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to withstand arid conditions.
